availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in 1818 Stanford Kentucky. Kentucky native. Studied law in Lexington, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in Indiana in 1841. Resided in Bloomfield, Indiana. Member of the United States House of Representatives, 1844-1845. Served as captain in the Mexican-American War. Indiana State Senator 1847-1849. Kentucky state senator, 1860-1861. Raised a regiment of Kentuckians in Indiana. Colonel and later major General.

ab.bibl:
The Times Democrat (New Orleans) January 9th, 1869
Dawson, Joseph G. “General Lovell H. Rousseau and Louisiana Reconstruction.” Louisiana History 20 (Fall 1979): 373-91
